item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Santayana
item.description: "Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness." -- Santayana

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by William Wordsworth
A. Cooper add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Babe Ruth
item.description: "Every strike brings me closer to the next home run." -- Babe Ruth

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Babe Ruth
item.description: "Never allow the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game!" -- Babe Ruth

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by George F. Will
item.description: "Baseball, it is said, is only a game. True. And the Grand Canyon is only a hole in Arizona." -- George F. Will

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "(Baseball) is a game with a lot of waiting in it; it is a game with increasingly heightened anticipation of increasingly limited action" -- John Irving

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "I can throw an orange like a baseball, but I can’t eat a baseball like an orange. Let that be a life lesson for you. " -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Thomas Boswell
item.description: "More than any other American sport, baseball creates the magnetic, addictive illusion that it can almost be understood." -- Thomas Boswell

item.title: A. Cooper add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I see great things in baseball." -- Walt Whitman
